column1: The name West Allis derives from Edward P. Allis
column2: whose Edward P. Allis Company was a large Milwaukee-area manufacturing firm in the late 19th century. In 1901
column4: and in 1902 built a large new manufacturing plant west of its existing plant. The locale in which the new plant was constructed was at the time called North Greenfield
column5: and prior to the 1880s had been called Honey Creek. With the building of the western Allis plant
column6: the area was incorporated as the Village of West Allis
column7: and it became the City of West Allis in 1906.With the presence of Allis-Chalmers
column8: the largest manufacturer in the area
column9: West Allis became the largest suburb of Milwaukee in the early 20th century. After that
column10: West Allis grew quickly. Between 1910 and 1930
column12: the Allis-Chalmers company's fortunes had turned. By 1985
column13: Allis-Chalmers's global workforce had shrunk to 13
column16: West Allis has had some success attracting other employers
